body:
So, looking at the leaderboards and rankings, i realize you dont have to be good at all! the trick is time and dedication. Since everyone's ping bases around like 30-250, the pvp experience is basically trading hits and then gear and weapons come into play. i dont really know why i made this, maybe as kind of a guide to those new players who wont already think this is sarcasm. 

But anyways

Post your  ideas about the Prestige season, stats, and other irrelevant stuff!
body_tagged:

But anyways

Post your  ideas about the Prestige season, stats, and other irrelevant stuff!
title: [DISCUSSION] XP leaderboards and rankings

replies.body: Prestige doesnt necessarily mean good player, there is the non xp leaderboard aswell. also anyone has a chance to get prestige which is nice
replies.body_tagged: Prestige doesnt necessarily mean good player, there is the non xp leaderboard aswell. also anyone has a chance to get prestige which is nice

replies.body: Well generally if you're a good player it is much easier to get prestige, so there is a slight relationship between prestige and how good you're. Also, it is not always trading hits but the occurrence of hit trading has definitely increased recently.
replies.body_tagged: Well generally if you're a good player it is much easier to get prestige, so there is a slight relationship between prestige and how good you're. Also, it is not always trading hits but the occurrence of hit trading has definitely increased recently.

replies.body: Yeah you don't have to be good to prestige, you just have to dedicate time to gain exp.
replies.body_tagged: Yeah you don't have to be good to prestige, you just have to dedicate time to gain exp.

replies.body: To me, a huge part of prestige is farming. I constantly see like 4 people on Mix just grinding and farming XP. Obviously you need to be a decent player to be able to get kills but I just feel that prestige isn't really a good representation of it. It's purely based on how efficiently you can play for XP and how much time you dedicate to the game. I do personally think that it is somewhat broken because of this. I had planned to sweat the Summer prestiges but decided against it because I'm just not someone that finds playing on Mix with 3 other players more enjoyable than playing Destroy with 30+ players.
